runs.comm: fizzer! Cracking delivery, outside off, lifting, seaming, and bursting past the edge. Lively start!
a touch too short this time, too much width as well, and Smith clobbers that through the covers for the first boundary
short again, too wide, and pulled emphatically through wide mid-on. Two in two
fuller length this time, still wide of off stump, but no stroke from Smith
full and swinging away from wide outside off. Smith reaches for a cover-drive but can't connect properly
too wide once again, swinging away and Smith reaches with greater success this time. A futile chase on the cover boundary, and that's an expensive start

inswinger, slightly misdirected and flicks the pad, but what's this ... a sharp throw from fine leg as he dallied over his second run ... and that's going to be out! Exceptional fielding, and Afghanistan have their first wicket of the match!
outside off, left alone and through to the keeper
clunked into the covers to get off the mark
flicked firmly to short fine leg, where Noor Ali fumbles to gift an extra run
driven on the up and into the covers. But straight to the man
angling into the pads, worked into the leg-side and a bit of Flash Harry fielding gives away another extra run. He went for it one-handed, and let it through his fingers
clipped off the toes, out to square leg
that's a snorting delivery - real lift from a good length and the keeper had to take off vertically to pouch that. Kallis looks non-plussed
had to hurry to make his ground, but beat the shy
full and targetting the blockhole, Smith had to dig that out late but squeezed it through the gap at third man
too short and wide, but just helped into the leg-side with a measured pull. Tidied up in the deep
short, squatted away, a fat top-edge, and that clears everything and everyone! Plops over the fine-leg boundary for six! A brisk start from the captain
onto the front foot to drive, but inside-edged onto the pads

A Pietersen-esque Flamingo flick into the leg-side, but picked up on the square-leg boundary. Umpire Gould has a quick check to see whether Kallis made his ground as the shy came in, but he was easily home
tighter line and length, worked into space
short and angling down the leg-side, and helped up and over the backward square-leg boundary! Excellent elevation on that stroke, and another six
fuller and straighter. Nothing doing there
bludgeoned, and Kallis is in a mood here. In the slot, and belted over cow corner for another maximum
looped onto a good length, and watchfully defended
Nabi strikes! Good length again, Smith was drawn into the stroke but was onto the ball early, and sent a spiralling chance down to long-off, where the skipper steadied himself to take a fine catch
short and wide, and cut to point. Straight to the man
flicked off the front foot, to midwicket
lovely bowling, held its line just outside off stump, and zipped past the edge. No spin on that one
tidy finish to a tidy over. The brake has duly been applied
good length to start things off, clipped to long-on
right up in the blockhole, pushed out to cover
saw de Villiers coming and fired in a shorter, quicker ball. Canny bowling
a touch wider, and flailed to point
pushed out to cover, excellent rhythm so far
turn and bounce, the keeper takes with a leap, and that's an excellent over. Two good overs in a row, and Afghanistan have exerted a small measure of control as the Powerplay ends
flogged into the covers off the front foot. A bit of in-drift for Nabi
wider outside off, and an excellent pouncing stop at point from Hamid
driven up to mid-off
more bounce from a tight line, but Kallis rides it well and dabs a cut down to third man
turn this time from a tight line. Kallis attempts another dab, but this time makes less contact
tossed up, dragged forward, met with a defensive bat. Nice over
emphatic drive out to deep cover, a misfield gifts an extra run, but the fielder recovers to save the four
flight and bite, and that's a beauty. Kallis acknowledges that he's beaten by that one, which really gripped
dabbed into the covers
worked out to point with soft hands
driven hard down to long-off
another nudge to point, had to hurry as the shy came in, but an easy single in the end
attempted sweep, down the leg-side
down the track, and clipped to long-on
into position for the sweep, but no contact
worked down to fine leg off mostly pad
belted. High and handsome, over long-off, and that rebounds off the window of the press box! Sizeable
flicked out to midwicket
nudged into the covers, and tidied up
a hint of turn, and drilled to the man at short cover
an ambitious fling of the bat, and pierces the covers at a catchable height. Excellent bowling, tempting the risk
on the money again, keeping things under wraps
down the track, but can only pad this away
punched out to cover, tidy bowling again
that's an exceptional over, which finishes with a deflection to square leg. Nothing to work with whatsoever
ooh, so near! A loose drive, and there was an audible snick on that, and sure enough, that was dropped by the keeper
insult to injury. de Villiers dances down the track and swats a boundary though midwicket
and that's just reward for Afghanistan! De Villiers attacks once again, but is deceived in the flight, and that's an easy stumping as the third wicket falls
looped up, and defended on off stump
driven firmly off the front foot, and Duminy is off the mark
punched into the covers, and that's another single for Kallis
a mistimed slog out to cow corner, but falls safe. Shenwari is a deceptive bowler
lovely work again, tight on off stump and straightening into the left-hander
slightly shorter, and flicked off the hip
a stand-and-deliver strike, but the shot fails to reach its destination
cracked out to deep cover
worked into the covers again, and that's the end of an exceptional spell from Shenwari. He's applied a measure of control, and then some
down the leg-side, a loose flick, and that's snaffled! Kallis walks, and Afghanistan have their fourth!
punched firmly down to mid-off, with a loud click of willow
round the wicket, and Duminy is cramped for room by a tight angled delivery
slower ball, Duminy waits and nudges a single down to third man
attempted yorker, and a pretty good one too. Well dug out and a sharp single
good bowling, brisk pace through the air, and Duminy is late on his stroke from round the wicket
worked out to square leg, can't beat the field
loopy-doopy delivery, plops onto a good length, and tucked round the corner
big stride forward, and a defensive push into the covers
pushed into the off side again
worked down to long-off. Tidy bowling
on the pads, tucked square. Another fine over, only three runs coming from that
full length, dead in front of middle, and that's plumb! Simon Taufel raises the finger, and Afghanistan are having a real go here!
round the wicket and that's a snorter. Sharp lift from a good length, and that surprises Morkel who wears it on the bat handle
much fuller this time, a good double-whammy
angling down the leg-side, worked with the pace down to fine leg, but no boundary
a short-arm pull to deep midwicket. More energetic bowling here
slower delivery, a legcutter to complete another fine over. Great effort from the new boys
round the wicket, a hint of turn, worked to midwicket
onto the front foot, punched to deep cover. Not much more than singles on offer at the moment
worked to midwicket. Tight again
low full toss, but smacked hard, back at the bowler
that's better from Morkel! In the slot for the shot, a full wind-up, and a mighty blow over long-on
quicker delivery, pushed to midwicket.
round the wicket, slower delivery, just outside off, and beats the bat. Good bowling
a fraction too short, and mowed through midwicket. Excellent strike, and perfect placement
in the blockhole, and huge cries of "catch it!" as Noor Ali opted to save the boundary at long-off rather than go for glory. On balance, a good decision
another good slower ball, and Duminy is all at sea as he fishes limply outside off
a baseball-style mow, but no great contact
opens the face, and that's a sweet glide through third man. That was yorker-length, but Morkel was equal to it
beautiful strike, arrow-straight back over the bowler's head, and now South Africa are turning it on
better delivery, fuller and straight
a big wind-up, but not much contact as the ball dribbles out to mid-on
in the air briefly, but the ball doesn't carry to midwicket
panned out to deep midwicket
front foot planted, big swing of the bat, mid-off charged in for the catch, but the mishit still had the legs to carry all the way over the rope!
big swing, and Morkel doesn't know where that went, but he's called through for an easy single
belted fiercely out to the covers, but Mangal clings onto a blinder, low to his right, to send Duminy on his way! Another wicket falls, and that was timely in the extreme
brisk delivery, but Roelof negotiates it
a swing and a miss
angled into the pads, great pace as well
round the wicket, a blockhole delivery is dug out to cover, and that's a superb spell from Hassan. He is genuinely swift. And he's given his team a chance. Just a chance ...
good bowling, saw Morkel making room, and followed him down the leg-side with a full delivery
a wild swing, and no contact. Unsubtle
a low full-toss, not a bad delivery in the circumstances, and long-off fields
a massive swipe, a vast spiralling top-edge, the captain calls for a steepler, fumbles at the first attempt, but clings onto the rebound. What a showing from Afghanistan!
in the blockhole again, drilled down to long-off, and they turn down the second run

full toss, panned out to deep point, and that's an exemplary display from Afghanistan. South Africa's total is still substantial, but it's been a spirited effort from a team who were competing against the likes of Jersey and Denmark only a couple of years ago
